title: Available Maps
text: 50 US states
code: get_coordinates(map = "usa50", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(fill = "grey35", color = "white") +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: Available Maps
text: 50 US States, District Columbia, territories (Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Northern Marina Islands) freely associated states (Micronesia, Marshall Islands Palau).
code: get_coordinates(map = "usa59", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(fill = "grey35", color = "white") +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: Available Maps
text: 50 US States, District Columbia (DC), 5 territories (Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Northern Marina Islands), freely associated state Palau. WIOA: Workforce Innovation Opportunity (workforce dev. legislation) ETA: Department Labor’s Employment Training Administration ETA regions rarely plotted , nice add border group states region together.
code: get_coordinates(map = "usaETA", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = eta_region_name), color = "white") +    geom_sf(data = get_coordinates("usaETAregions", "hexmap"),            fill = NA, color = "grey35", linewidth = 1) +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: CSR for Map
text: ’s possible ‘square’ hex map changing coordinate reference system (CRS) WGS 84 / Pseudo-Mercator CRS (EPSG code 3857).
code: sf_geojson <- st_transform(sf_geojson, 3857) gg1 <- ggplot(sf_geojson) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(aes(label=abbr_usps)) +   labs(title = "geojson - hexagons look the same size when change CRS to 3857") +    theme_void()  gg2 <- ggplot(sf_usahex) +    geom_sf() +    geom_sf_text(aes(label=abbr_usps)) +   labs(title = "usahex - all hexagons are the same size without CRS") +    theme_void()  plot_grid(gg1, gg2, nrow = 1)

title: CSR for Map
text: order plot two different labels, need two different points. geojson hex map usahex map need transformed. geojson needs large numbers order adjust plot location (+/- 100000) becuase coordinates actual lat/long values. usahex maps needs small +/- 5 units adjust labels.
code: gg1 <-ggplot(sf_geojson) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_geojson, geometry = geometry + c(0, 100000)) |>        sf::st_set_crs(3857),       aes(label=abbr_usps),      fontface = "bold",      size = 3.25   ) +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_geojson, geometry = geometry + c(0, -100000)) |>        sf::st_set_crs(3857),       aes(label=fips),      size = 2.25   ) +   labs(title = "geojson -large adjustment values") +    theme_void()  gg2 <- ggplot(sf_usahex) +    geom_sf() +      geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_usahex, geometry = geometry + c(0, 5)),       aes(label=abbr_usps),      fontface = "bold",      size = 3.25   ) +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_usahex, geometry = geometry + c(0, -5)),       aes(label=fips),      size = 2.25   ) +   labs(title = "usahex - small adjustment values") +    theme_void()  plot_grid(gg1, gg2, nrow = 1)

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: 2-letter code used United States Postal Service (USPS). USPS abbreviations pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations.

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Abbreviations US Government Printing Office (GPO). GPO abbreviations pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations. Freely associated states (Micronesia, Marshall Islands, Palau) GPO abbreviations

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Abbreviations AP Stylebook. AP abbreviations pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations. Territories (Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands) freely associated states (Micronesia, Marshall Islands, Palau) AP abbreviations

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Abbreviation name geography either 3-4 characters.

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Abbreviation name geography 5-6 characters, except : 4 geographies whose name less 5 characters; use full names (Iowa, Ohio, Utah, Guam) Northern Mariana Islands = N.Mar.. Marshall Islands = Mar.. U.S. Virgin Islands = U.S.V..

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Name geographic area. Names pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations.

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: 2-digit FIPS code (Federal Information Processing Standard). FIPS codes pulled Wikipedia’s List U.S. state territory abbreviations.

title: Geography Abbreviations and Information
text: Type region: state, federal district, territory, freely associated state

text: Martha Eichlersmith. Author, maintainer.

code: @Manual{,   title = {usahex: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)},   author = {Martha Eichlersmith},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://mareichler.github.io/usahex/}, }

what: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: simple packages includes hex maps United States multiple options different geographies. hex maps available public use 50 states + DC: R Graph Gallery Datawrapper. However, ignores territories (also referred outlying areas) freely associated states. CDC Open-Source Visualization Editor (COVE) addresses putting hexagons line bottom 50 states + DC hex map. However, coordinates provided json file available cdc-open-vis GitHub 50 states + DC provide coordinates territories freely associated states.

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: includes hex maps territories freely associate states simple hexagon coordinates (based lat/long coordinates): makes much easier add/subtract/move hexagons want map different permutations, can make !

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: Hex maps much better displaying information state--state basis. US choropleth maps using metrics relate land size, need use traditional lat/long map. Traditional maps emphasis large-land geographies makes small-land geographies difficult see. Hex maps easier displaying data unique state basis allow enough space put actual values map EVERY GEOGRAPHY (just large-land geographies)

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: Back covid times, NPR used hex maps (included US territories) show different covid related metrics. reached Alyson Hurt, Supervising Graphics Editor pointed dailygraphics-templates file GitHub contained coordinates map. ’ve made small adjustments, moving pacific island hexagons around adding new ones; coordinates basis maps package. y values reversed plot upside .

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: packages uses sf package (sf = simple features) create shape objects easy plot using ggplot2 package, preferred medium data visualizations.

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: usa59 hex map showing geographies available
code: library(usahex) library(ggplot2) allgeos <- get_coordinates(map = "usa59", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = geo_type)) +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps)) +    theme_void() allgeos

title: Hex Maps of USA Geographies (states, federal district, territories, and freely associated states)
text: files can found data-raw folder GitHub. X Y coordinates 7 coordinates state create hexagon. cX cY repeated center coordinates create single point center given hexagons. raw files can also used create ggplot2 items don’t want work simple features (sf) objects: usa53 hex map created csv file
code: csv <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarEichler/usahex/refs/heads/main/data-raw/usa53.csv" read.csv(csv)[1:14,] ##    hexmap abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap abbr_short abbr_long    name fips geo_type ## 1   usa53        AL     Ala.    Ala.       Ala.     Alab. Alabama    1    state ## 2   usa53        AL     Ala.    Ala.       Ala.     Alab. Alabama    1    state ## 3   usa53        AL     Ala.    Ala.       Ala.     Alab. Alabama    1    state ## 4   usa53        AL     Ala.    Ala.       Ala.     Alab. Alabama    1    state ## 5   usa53        AL     Ala.    Ala.       Ala.     Alab. Alabama    1    state ## 6   usa53        AL     Ala.    Ala.       Ala.     Alab. Alabama    1    state ## 7   usa53        AL     Ala.    Ala.       Ala.     Alab. Alabama    1    state ## 8   usa53        AK   Alaska  Alaska        Ak.    Alaska  Alaska    2    state ## 9   usa53        AK   Alaska  Alaska        Ak.    Alaska  Alaska    2    state ## 10  usa53        AK   Alaska  Alaska        Ak.    Alaska  Alaska    2    state ## 11  usa53        AK   Alaska  Alaska        Ak.    Alaska  Alaska    2    state ## 12  usa53        AK   Alaska  Alaska        Ak.    Alaska  Alaska    2    state ## 13  usa53        AK   Alaska  Alaska        Ak.    Alaska  Alaska    2    state ## 14  usa53        AK   Alaska  Alaska        Ak.    Alaska  Alaska    2    state ##            X    Y        cX   cY ## 1  278.01270 -180 278.01270 -200 ## 2  295.33321 -190 278.01270 -200 ## 3  295.33321 -210 278.01270 -200 ## 4  278.01270 -220 278.01270 -200 ## 5  260.69219 -210 278.01270 -200 ## 6  260.69219 -190 278.01270 -200 ## 7  278.01270 -180 278.01270 -200 ## 8   35.52559    0  35.52559  -20 ## 9   52.84610  -10  35.52559  -20 ## 10  52.84610  -30  35.52559  -20 ## 11  35.52559  -40  35.52559  -20 ## 12  18.20508  -30  35.52559  -20 ## 13  18.20508  -10  35.52559  -20 ## 14  35.52559    0  35.52559  -20 df <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarEichler/usahex/refs/heads/main/data-raw/usa53.csv")    gg <- ggplot(df, aes(group=abbr_usps)) +   geom_polygon(aes(x=X, y=Y), color = "white", fill = "grey35") +   geom_text(     data=dplyr::distinct(df, abbr_usps, cX, cY), # only need 1coord per state     aes(label=abbr_usps, x = cX, y = cY),      size = 3.25,      color = "white"   ) +   coord_fixed() +    theme_void() gg

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: Import hex map coordinates

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: map character string specifying map. Current options "usa50" (50 US States ), "usa51" (50 states DC), "usa52" (50 states, DC, Puerto Rico), "usa53" (50 states, DC, PUerto Rico Virgin Islands), "usa56" (50 states, DC, territories (PR, VI, , GU, MP)), "usa56" (50 states, DC, territories (PR, VI, , GU, MP), freely associate states (FM, MH, PW)), "usaETA" (US DOL ETA geographies, usa56 addition freely associate state Palau), "usaETARegions" (unified maps US DOL ETA regions) . coords character string specifying "hexmap" hexagon coordinates "labels" label coordinates hex map

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: sf object map, either hexagons (polygon) labels (point).

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
code: get_coordinates(map = "usa50", coords = "hexmap") #> Simple feature collection with 50 features and 8 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0.8845727 ymin: -250 xmax: 433.8973 ymax: 0 #> CRS:           NA #> # A tibble: 50 × 9 #>    abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap abbr_short abbr_long name        fips  geo_type #>  * <fct>     <fct>    <fct>   <chr>      <chr>     <fct>       <chr> <chr>    #>  1 AK        Alaska   Alaska  Ak.        Alaska    Alaska      02    state    #>  2 AL        Ala.     Ala.    Ala.       Alab.     Alabama     01    state    #>  3 AR        Ark.     Ark.    Ark.       Arkan.    Arkansas    05    state    #>  4 AZ        Ariz.    Ariz.   Arz.       Ariz.     Arizona     04    state    #>  5 CA        Calif.   Calif.  Cal.       Calif.    California  06    state    #>  6 CO        Colo.    Colo.   Col.       Colo.     Colorado    08    state    #>  7 CT        Conn.    Conn.   Con.       Conn.     Connecticut 09    state    #>  8 DE        Del.     Del.    Del.       Dela.     Delaware    10    state    #>  9 FL        Fla.     Fla.    Fla.       Flor.     Florida     12    state    #> 10 GA        Ga.      Ga.     Ga.        Georg.    Georgia     13    state    #> # ℹ 40 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: geometry <POLYGON> get_coordinates(map = "usa50", coords = "labels") #> Simple feature collection with 50 features and 8 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 18.20508 ymin: -230 xmax: 416.5768 ymax: -20 #> CRS:           NA #> # A tibble: 50 × 9 #>    abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap abbr_short abbr_long name        fips  geo_type #>  * <fct>     <fct>    <fct>   <chr>      <chr>     <fct>       <chr> <chr>    #>  1 AK        Alaska   Alaska  Ak.        Alaska    Alaska      02    state    #>  2 AL        Ala.     Ala.    Ala.       Alab.     Alabama     01    state    #>  3 AR        Ark.     Ark.    Ark.       Arkan.    Arkansas    05    state    #>  4 AZ        Ariz.    Ariz.   Arz.       Ariz.     Arizona     04    state    #>  5 CA        Calif.   Calif.  Cal.       Calif.    California  06    state    #>  6 CO        Colo.    Colo.   Col.       Colo.     Colorado    08    state    #>  7 CT        Conn.    Conn.   Con.       Conn.     Connecticut 09    state    #>  8 DE        Del.     Del.    Del.       Dela.     Delaware    10    state    #>  9 FL        Fla.     Fla.    Fla.       Flor.     Florida     12    state    #> 10 GA        Ga.      Ga.     Ga.        Georg.    Georgia     13    state    #> # ℹ 40 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: geometry <POINT>

title: usa50 shapefile data — usa50
text: Hexagon map shape file includes: 50 States

title: usa50 shapefile data — usa50
text: Simple feature collection abbr_usps 2-letter code used United States Postal Service abbr_gpo abbreviations US Government Printing Office abbr_ap abbreviations AP Stylebook abbr_short abbreviations 3-4 characters abbr_long abbreviations 4-8 characters, 5-6 characters name Name geographic area fips 2-digit FIPS code (Federal Information Processing Standard) geo_type Type region: state, federal district, territory, freely associated state geometry polygon coordinates hexagon
